intro: Minuartia dirphya, commonly known as the two-lobed sandflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal or arid environments. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in harsh conditions. Minuartia dirphya is well-suited to xerophytic habitats and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover in dry landscapes.
